results.title: New uses for Seaweed
results.brief_description: A brief account of the uses to which alginates, which are obtained from seaweed, are being put - from foodstuffs to toothpaste. A fine synthetic fibre, spun from the jelly is used in the manufacture of light-weight woollen materials.

results.title: The New South Asia
results.creator_credit: Donald Fraser, National Film Board of Canada and United Nations. Film Board
results.brief_description: A report on social and economic conditions in the five nations of southern Asia. The film portrays the surge of independence and determination to work out their own future which has permeated every phase of national life for this one-fourth of the world’s population, and which is bringing advances in health and living standards. The assistance of the United Nations in providing the knowledge and the plans with which to develop education, social welfare, agriculture and industry is shown.

results.title: New explorers
results.creator_credit: James Hill, James Carr and World Wide Pictures
results.brief_description: How experts in various methods of prospecting seek oil throughout the world. The principle locations in the film are Papua, Sicily, Canada, Trinidad, Zanzibar and the Persian Gulf.

results.title: The New councillor
results.brief_description: Through the experiences of Richards, a newly elected borough councillor, shows the varied activities of a typical councillor - the people’s relationship both with the people who elected him and the permanent officials who carry out the policy laid down by the council.

results.title: Neorealism
results.brief_description: Documentary exploring the Italian film movement, Neo-realism, which developed during World War II and dealt with moral, social and political problems in real locations. Includes interviews with Roberto Rossellini, Vittorio De Sica, Michaelangelo Antonioni, Pier Paolo Pasolini and Bernardo Bertolucci. Features film clips from Rossellini’s “Rome, open city” and “Paisa” and De Sica’s “Umberto D”.

results.title: Nebule
results.creator_credit: Bernard Longpre, Rene Jodoin and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: In this animated film a black line becomes a magic cord to serve a small child’s fancy. In Nebule’s hands it becomes whatever he wills and the metamorphoses, played out against a soft, pastelcolored background, encompass the world of a child’s fears and fancies. A film without narration.
